results.title: The Visit to Victoria of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II and His Royal Highness the Duke of Edinburgh
results.brief_description: A unique record of an outstanding historical event, the arrival at Essendon Airport on 24 February 1954, of Queen Elizabeth and the Duke of Edinburgh and their subsequent tour of the State of Victoria. Photographed by a large team of professional cameramen, in privileged positions, the film contains such exclusive scenes as the opening of State Parliament and the Royal Command Performance at the Princess Theatre, visits to Hamilton, Benalla, Sale, Traralgon, Yallourn and Mildura; races at Flemington; Flinders Naval Depot; and The University of Melbourne. The film captures all the excitement of the great occasion and shows many interesting sidelights of the Royal progress throughout the State.

results.title: Exploration 1770, reviewed 1970
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Stanley Dalby and Frank Bagnall
results.brief_description: Contrasts Captain Cook’s observations on his voyage along the eastern coast of Australia in 1770 with scenes of the Royal Visit in 1970 and bicentenary celebrations including re-enactments of his landings. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: All that is solid
results.brief_description: This is a speculative documentary on the subject of the future of Australia. It is conceived as a series of competing discourses with visionaries, politicians, media commentators and others, who are variously optimistic and pessimistic. Interviews are interspersed with symbolic, imaginative drama.

results.title: Seaside holiday
results.brief_description: A motoring holiday along some of Victoria’s most beautiful coast roads, introducing some of the scenic beauties to be found along the highways which skirt the ocean beaches of this State.

results.title: Encounter
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Aboriginal Affairs and Dept of Agriculture, Vic
results.brief_description: Lake Tyers, which has been home to Aborigines for over one hundred years, was the site of a camp for aboriginal and non-aboriginal boys for ten days. Under the watchful eyes of voluntary skilled instructors the boys swam, sailed, canoed, scuba-dived, went hiking, fishing and played the residents at cricket. They made friends and learned teamwork and co-operation. Narrated by David Johnson.

results.title: Maidenhead
results.brief_description: Maidenhead is a series of chamber-fictions inhabited by a young woman named Alice. Linked in an oblique, dream like way, these short, sharp stories describe Alice’s survival in an everyday world of bizarre logic and strange emotions. It’s a place where miracles unfold in the bathroom and desire appears on a bus; where menacing joggers roam the suburbs and there’s something sinister about hats. Vibrant like musical, Maidenhead is at once funny and disquieting, poignant and absurd.

results.title: Ship No. 76
results.brief_description: Shows all stages of the construction of the 18,600 ton oil tanker, B.P. Endeavour, at the Newcastle State Dockyard. The Endeavour was the largest ship built in Australia up to 1967.

results.title: Grampians wonderland
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria, David Swift and Gil Brealey
results.brief_description:
The Grampians mountain ranges rising from the plains of western Victoria were discovered by Major Mitchell and continue to delight tourists. This program shows the exquisite wildflowers, the animal life, the rugged mountain scenery and the foaming waterfalls which make the Grampians so beautiful and so popular. Winner of an AFI Award: 1959.

The convertable car used in this film is a Triumph TR3A.

results.title: The Simpson automa-boot
results.brief_description: This film is an amusing animated cartoon made by Form I students from Moorabbin Technical College. It follows the activities of an “automatic boot” which takes the user wherever they may wish to go in a fantasy world. The producer’s aim was to give the students an opportunity for creative work in which cooperation between students, descriptive writing, animation of the human form and self-disclipine would be required. Animation by Colin Jenkins and Andrew Mougemore. Painters - Neil Stevenson, Tony McFarland, Steven Witcraft, Dave Harmo, Emily McPherson, Trevor Williams.
